New Records: Adolis García set a record for RBIs in a postseason series with 15.
García also tied for the fourth-longest home run streak in postseason history.
Key Match Events: The Rangers scored three runs in the first inning and kept increasing their lead en route to a Game 7 victory.
Corey Seager homered in the first inning as the Rangers took an early three-run lead.
Texas broke things open with a four-run fourth that featured a two-run double by rookie Evan Carter and a two-run single by García.
García slugged his sixth home run this postseason to make it 4-1 in the third before the Astros cut it to two on a solo homer by Alex Bregman in the bottom of the inning.
Jose Altuve hit his 27th career postseason homer in the ninth for Houston, two behind Manny Ramirez for most all-time.
Pre-Game Insights: Texas led the AL West for most of the year, only to squander the division crown to Houston with a loss at Seattle on the final day of the regular season that sent the streaky Rangers on the road to begin the playoffs.
The Rangers have gone 8-0 away from home in these playoffs, joining the 1996 Yankees as the only teams to win their first eight road games in one postseason.
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy, who came out of retirement this season to manage the Rangers, became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams.
Bochy said, ‘I didn’t know if I’d get back in it. And here I am. I know how blessed I am.’
Astros manager Dusty Baker said, ‘I don’t like tipping my cap to anybody. But when someone beats the hell out of you, what are you going to do?’
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers secured their spot in the World Series on Monday.
The Rangers will open an all-wild card World Series at home Friday night against Arizona or Philadelphia.
This was the second time the road team won every game in a best-of-seven postseason series.
Others: Jordan Montgomery pitched in relief and picked up the Game 7 win.
Max Scherzer, acquired from the Mets in July, allowed four hits and two runs with two walks in 2 2/3 innings.
